items.name: (Merged with Planetace's Astral Assembly) Colonial Ascension 1.0
items.summary: Ever wanted to make your colonies stupid big, but you didn't want to go in and mess with the vanilla files?
items.description:
Ever wanted to make your colonies stupid big, but you didn't want to go in and mess with the vanilla files?

Well, Colonial Ascension is here to solve all of your ~~laziness~~ problems.

With additional colony sizes ranging from the vanilla 10 all the way to 25 (including custom descriptions), you'll be guaranteed to...never reach most of these outside of excessively powerful modded bullshit or custom console commands, let's be honest.

Have fun trying, I guess!

items.summary:
Based on https://gomtuu.org/starsearcher/ 
Things I have added:
items.description:
Based on https://gomtuu.org/starsearcher/ 
Things I have added:
1. Search for planets based on certain conditions (resources etc)
2. Search for planets based on distance to core world
3. Show a flag to indicated if a planet has a gate or domain comm array in the system
4. Increase the search timeout to 120 seconds
5. Fixed a bug that causes all planets' ruin conditions show as "Scattered Ruins" 
6. Display Techmining Multplier; if the text is bold, the ruin has not been explored - June 13, 2023
7. Add some exception handling when reading the save file, probably better compatibility with mods. If you have some issue with your save, send it to me and I would take a look. - June 20, 2023
8. Added a filter for planet type - September 15, 2023
9. I have published the project on cloudflare. https://starsearcher-modded-by-sycspy.pages.dev/index-1.htm - September 20, 2023

items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: **Now with refit-screen integration! (Should now work with JRE8)**
items.description:
**Now with refit-screen integration! (Should now work with JRE8)**

*Requires 0.96a-RC10+*

**A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**

Install and press J in combat, in refit, or on the world map to open a GUI.

Features:     
- Many tags, such as targeting or avoiding shields, PD mode and many many more
- GUI-based configuration in combat/refit or on the campaign map
- Tags are automatically saved between combats and reloads
- Seamlessly switch between simple mode (6 tags) and advanced mode (over 20 tags)
- Customize AI-controlled ship behavior through ship modes
- Create your own default tags with the option to automatically apply them
- Customize most aspects of the mod through an extensive settings file
- Manually control multiple weapon groups at once using the Merge tag

```
Can be updated/added/removed to/from ongoing campaigns.
```

```
To mod-authors:
If you want to integrate with AGC to improve ship/weapon AI behavior of your faction, check the readme. Feel free to ping me if you need help or want to request a special mode.
Example integration code: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-symbiotic-void-creatures/blob/main/src/tecrys/svc/hullmods/BGECarapace.kt#L98
```

items.name: Alkemia Armoury
items.summary:
**Starsector Update Edition!**
A new faction (and another surprise one) with many new generally available ship hulls: Kestrel-class Frigate, Perch-class Heavy Carrier, Roost-class Carrier, Lifter Cargo Courier, and the large modular battlecruiser sized Rigger Salvager. Some Planetary Structures I felt were missing, some new space station and ship variants. Dedicated hullmods, ship systems and an additional bar mission to add to the Alkemia faction flavour
items.description:
**Starsector Update Edition!**
A new faction (and another surprise one) with many new generally available ship hulls: Kestrel-class Frigate, Perch-class Heavy Carrier, Roost-class Carrier, Lifter Cargo Courier, and the large modular battlecruiser sized Rigger Salvager. Some Planetary Structures I felt were missing, some new space station and ship variants. Dedicated hullmods, ship systems and an additional bar mission to add to the Alkemia faction flavour 
A few additional secrets scattered across the sector to find on you exploration trips. Enjoy!
Note: The Alkemia faction works best in a generated sector right now, as I haven't added any custom planets for Corvus mode yet.
**Save compatibility**: Yes, as always.
**Changelog:**
```
* 0.9.48
Tested with the latest Starsector release! Woohoo!
Added: 
 + Quad Vulcan Array
 + Erpel Escort variant
Fixed:
 + some typos in descriptions
 + Replaced EMP Missile graphics that ware inadvertently appropriated from IndEvo - deepest apologies to SirHartley again. 
```

items.description:
All the Domain Drones (ATDD+)   
A collection of mods which adds/buffs/modifies the Derelict Drones found out in the wild of Starsector. These mods should be 100% compatible with all other mods excluding major overhauls that aren't normally compatible with any other mods.

**Changelog:**
New Drones+
Vanilla+

I only updated the version. As I have heard it still works. I will be playing with it soon.
I will also test the submods. Hopefully will update those in the coming weeks.


**Mods available:**
**All the Domain Drones+ Vanilla**
Recommended new save. I cannot guarantee this mod will work on an existing save.
This mod modifies Vanilla drones, increasing their stats. It also upgrades the Domain Faction and allows Motherships and Survey Ships to spawn Derelict fleets as if they were [REDACTED] Battlestations. Download Link:  https://www.dropbox.com/s/lxqxz8w8j4zemrx/Domain%20Drones%2B%20Vanilla.rar?dl=1

**All the Domain Drones+ New Drones**
Should work on existing saves, do tell me if it doesn't.
This mod adds new Domain Drones. Capital ships, Cruisers, Destroyers, fuel ships, cargo ships, frigates, wings, mining ships, carriers and a new buildable Derelict Station (with three Tiers) to colonies. Also adds proper survey ships and probes to those explorable. Overhauls the Mothership into a more threatening station. Derelict stations can also appear as Pirate stations, these send Derelict raids (you can also buy ships from them, don't ask why). Download Link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/xxdaflon17jhg2k/All%20the%20Domain%20Drones%2B%20New%20Drones.rar?dl=1

items.name: Astral Ascension
items.summary: A mod that uncaps the "standard" colony size of 10 (tens of billions) and allows colony sizes to reach sizes all the way up to 100 (a Googol people). With custom icons, descriptions, and a console command if you want to reach those sizes within a timeframe not measured in epochs.
items.description:
A mod that uncaps the "standard" colony size of 10 (tens of billions) and allows colony sizes to reach sizes all the way up to 100 (a Googol people). With custom icons, descriptions, and a console command if you want to reach those sizes within a timeframe not measured in epochs.

Is this mod balanced? Absolutely not. Will it break your save? Yea, definitely, either from some bug I didn't find, or because your standard Fast Pickets have several Supercaps and make minced-meat of absolutely everything.

Is it fun? Oh for SURE.

General Note: If you have no active 11+ planets in the Sector, it might be possible to add new updates mid-save. But DO MAKE A SAVE BACKUP!

Credits - Collaboration between <@241524790161047552> and <@271992186361348097>

items.summary: Write custom log messages. Automatically generates intel reports for unexplored ruins, salvageable ships, hypershunts, cryosleepers, and more.
items.description:
Write custom log messages. Automatically generates intel reports for unexplored ruins, salvageable ships, hypershunts, cryosleepers, and more.

Changelog:

```
- Add GUI with multi-line text editing for writing Captain's Log custom messages
  - Accessible from the control panel in the intel screen or using the shortcut (default P) in the campaign
- Automatically log the location of Comm Relays located outside the Core Worlds
- Automatically log the location of Coronal Hypershunts
- Add version checker changelog support
- Add LunaLib support
- Add LunaLib settings to enable/disable each type of automated intel logging
- Add LunaLib settings to set whether Captain's Log custom log messages should be marked as important by default
- Rework intel reports to more closely follow vanilla style
- Removed console command support (most functionality ported to GUI functions)
- Change ignore hotkeys to use g rather than i
- Updated salvageable ship intels to use the ship sprite as the icon rather than the map icon
- Fix bug that allowed players to use "lay in course" button to repeatedly salvage the same object.
```

items.summary: A collection of 31 questionable quality low cost hull mods
items.description:
A collection of 31 questionable quality low cost hull mods 

```v0.5 released today - Save Game compatible* - Note before installing the update if you have cargo carver, cargo filler or belt armor stacked on your ships, you need to load your 0.4.1 saved game, remove them then save game. You can now update to 0.5, you will just need to refit your changed ships when you resume your game.
    -Added a block to prevent Cargo Carver, Cargo Filler or Belt Armor on at the same time - They all take from the cargo of a ship, making them mutually exclusive made sense
    -Increased the % that Flux swap modifies from 5% to 10% - TY Aran1 for your comments regarding this and the above change    
    -Updated the game version compatibility to the current version (0.96a-RC10) - Minor QOL change so the version checker will stop giving you a warning
    -Moved the Exploration Refit hull mod from JYD to CJHM - They will both exist if you have both mods installed until I can get around to updating JYD
        -It removes the penalties from a civilian-grade hull, increases the maximum burn level, sensor and sight range,cargo space and reduces CR loss from corona and similar conditions 
        -In order to maintain these upgrades the ship requires more crew and uses more supplies per month - Essentially an exploration version of Militarized Subsystems
    - Added the image and description of the new hull mod to the picture on the forum OP    ```

items.summary: Create your own custom star systems via a JSON file in this mod's config folder! Includes a default custom star system, with superb candidates for colonization.
items.description:
Create your own custom star systems via a JSON file in this mod's config folder! Includes a default custom star system, with superb candidates for colonization.

*v1.0.2 Patch Notes*
```
* "marketSize" option now supports numbers greater than 10 if bigger population conditions exists due to other mods
  - If no such conditions exist (or their IDs do not match the "population_##" string), "marketSize" will continue to cap population size at 10, as before.

* Added "systemLightColor" option for custom star systems

* Added "orbitRadius" support for "accretion_disk" entities
  - Also scaled the default, randomly-generated orbit radius to fix it being smaller than typical proc-gen accretion disks

* Custom star systems with a center black hole no longer auto-generate an accretion disk entity

* Added "orbitDays" support for "ring" and "asteroid_belt" entities

* Fixed an outdated error message

* "ListCustomStarSystems" and "SpawnCustomStarSystems" commands now print the exception message when syntax errors in customStarSystems.json are found
```
*v1.0.3 Patch Notes*
```
* Fixed a bug where custom star systems with comm relays or similar entities were erroneously marked as though they contained a Coronal Hypershunt
  - This also fixes "isCoreWorldSystem" tags being overridden due to this same bug

* Fixed logging for generating custom star systems during new game creation

* "SpawnCustomStarSystems" command and the related LunaSnippet now print the exception messages for generation and syntax errors, respectively

* Minor code refactors
```
```Save-compatible```

items.name: Desperta Ferro
items.summary: A faction/ship/weapon mod. Featuring a high tech nation called the Jupitriss Union who espouses enlightenment via technology, but could be considered to be nothing more than raiding techno-pirates.
items.description:
A faction/ship/weapon mod. Featuring a high tech nation called the Jupitriss Union who espouses enlightenment via technology, but could be considered to be nothing more than raiding techno-pirates. 

Adds:
-24 Brand newly resprited not-so vanilla adjacent ships, 14 new fighter wings, 28 new weapons. and 20+ custom portraits. Custom Sounds, with unique effects, market music, star system, and deep codex lore.
-Don't want to join the Union? Raid their fortified star system for rare loot.
-The Union is a carrier focused faction with high flux pools, PD beams built into hulls, and an energy/missile focus. This is contrasted by their paper thin hull and armor, and high OP costs to their deployment and weapons.

Not save compatable!

I hope you enjoy it!

EHM: Experimental Hull Modifications
items.summary:
Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
` `
items.description:
Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
` `
**FOREWARNING**
The 'Experimental' in the title is not just for novelty. Please use "Save Copy" before using this mod; in other words, back your save up.
The goal of this mod is providing extreme customization; balance isn't on any priority list. Extreme cases will be adjusted but that's pretty much it.

**Hull Modifications:** Will become available immediately
 Experimental Hull Modifications: Provides a base to all other hull modifications in this mod
 Over-Engineered: Provides 20% OP bonus and some slot-points to the ship when built-in
 Logistics Overhaul: Strips the ship of all combat capabilities in favour of logistics
 Auxiliary Generators: Provides some slot-points in exchange for ordnance points
 AI Switch: Turns automated ships into normal, or normal ships into automated ones

**Hull Modification Categories:** Will become available immediately
 Systems: Most vanilla systems are turned into hull modifications
 Retrofits: Alters the weapon slots of a ship all together
 Cosmetics: Fully customizable hull modifications to change shield and engine colours. Customization is done through the mod settings menu
 Activators: Uses slot shunts to provide the ship with various enhancements by altering the slot they're installed on

**Slot Shunt Categories:** May be obtained after activating the new ability. These, along with their activators alter the ship in different ways
 Adapters: Turns a bigger slot into smaller versions (3 large, 1 medium types)
 Converters: Turns a smaller slot into a bigger one by using slot points (1 medium, 1 small types)
 Diverters: Turns a slot inactive and yield slot points to be used by above (1 small type)
 Capacitors: Enhances the total flux capacity of the ship (1 small type)
 Dissipators: Enhances the total flux dissipation of the ship (1 small type)
 Launch Tubes: Turns a large slot into a fighter hangar (1 large type)

```diff
+ Save compatible; safe to install/update
- Cannot be removed; back your save up
```

items.description:
A mod for Starsector that makes the Remnant and Sindrian Diktat more challenging to fight. Also adds new ships, boss bounties, weapons, hullmods, and the IX Battlegroup hostile faction.

The mod is split into two parts, the core Emergent Threats, and the ET: IX Revival faction submod (the 9th Domain Battlegroup was originally created by Inventor Raccoon for Arsenal Expansion, and is re-added with permission). The two parts interact with each other but can be used separately. 

Emergent Threats v0.3+ is currently in beta. The last stable release v0.2.6 can be found on the forums. I would appreciate any feedback and bug reports for the new version included in this post to help me polish the mod for the next forum release. items.name: Exotica Technologies
items.summary:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
items.description:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
Exotica Technologies offers an RPG element to Starsector that makes your ships AND enemies harder, better, faster, stronger through upgrades and exotics! These upgrades do not take OP or hullmod slots! Each ship has a limit to the number of upgrades they can install so choose wisely! The cost of each upgrade will require common materials salvaged across the sector such as metal and transplutonics. However, as upgrades get more complex and specialized, they tend to consume more resources and even demand special items found through research stations and mining stations!

Changelog in latest post. **1.6.0 makes the game harder.**
This mod requires MagicLib, LazyLib, LunaLib, and **the latest version of Combat Activators**.

Save compatible with all previous versions of Exotica and can be added mid-save with no loss of functionality, even for salvage exploration. This mod does not affect drops of other exploration items, namely colony items, and are rolled completely separately.
Download: https://github.com/scardwell15/ExoticaTechnologies/releases/download/v1.7.1/Exotica-Technologies-v1.7.1.zip

VRAM-Impact is around 70 mb during normal gameplay because the mod only loads images that you look at.

FAQ:
- "How do I start the questline?"
     - Talk to Jack Lapua on Asteria in Arcadia system, requires 20+ rep with Kesteven
- "Kesteven only has one market?"
     - Their main planet is Asteria in the Arcadia star system
- "What do I do with Artifact Electronics?"
     - You can trade them in at Asteria for Prototype ships and weapons after completing the first quest, or just sell them for cash.
- "Does this mod work mid save?"
     - Yes, everything will automatically generate as if you started a new save.

## What's Changed
- Add Azul Zulu to JRE swapper
  - This is part of a **research** effort requested by Alex himself, investigating the _possibility_ of making Java 8 the default for Starsector in the future.
  - Please see this discord post for more details: https://discord.com/channels/187635036525166592/451195604459192341/1091014766031540346
- Fix versions being wrong in mods list for mods that do not support Version Checker
- Some internal work to improve performance (unlikely to be noticeable)

**Highlights from the previous release:**
- _Two_ separate mod browsers
  - A web browser based one, and a custom one that sources from Wisp's Unofficial Mod Repo
- A JRE swapper/upgrade utility! Switch to JRE 8 automatically and without hassle
- Mod deletion! Accessed by right-clicking on any mod entry in the main view
- Column editing
- **Near full cross-platform compatibility! This includes: vmparams editing, JRE swapping, game version detection, game launching, etc**

**Known Issues:**
- Static Linux builds are dead and gone (they never worked lmao)
- On Linux, web-browser functionality requires webkit2gtk-4.1
    - Apologies for this. I can tell you that if you don't have this already it may be a pain in the ass to get installed. Alternatives are being explored.
- Linux binaries are only tested on Ubuntu20.02, and may not work on other distros
- On macOS, sub-windows may not render/appear forced into the background when using multiple monitors
  - Sub windows can be 'surfaced' by using Mission Control to see all application windows, and dragging the subwindow to your other monitor

**Downloading:**
As this seems to be a pretty common issue, here's two notes on downloading the app:

1. You **do not want** the source code from the main repository page. That means **do not** click the `<> Code` dropdown at all
2. The same goes for the release page. Open the `Assets` accordion/dropdown. But again, **do not** click on either of the archives/zips labelled `source`. You want one the files starting with `starsector_mod_manager` or `macos.zip` - the people that need the latter should know who they are...

**Website:** <https://atlanticaccent.github.io/starsector-mod-manager-rust/>
**Download**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust/releases/tag/0.7.2>
**Sources**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust>
**Forum**: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21995.0>

items.summary:
Adds some simple, totally optional settings of varying silliness to spice up your game.
``` ```
items.description:
Adds some simple, totally optional settings of varying silliness to spice up your game.
``` ```

# Current Features
-  Book of Grudges (negative rep with factions--and optionally players--lingers)
-  Autofit Tweaks (super minor, just reduces autofit randomness atm)
-  Pirate Scholars (now they can learn things automatically!  )
-  Blessed By Ludd (gives LP ships a chance to suppress Ill-Advised Mods)
-  Make Sindria Great Again (gives LG and Diktat ships a chance to suppress Special Modifications)
-  Doctrine Scaling (your favorite feature from last time, maybe, now better, maybe! if you're new here it means factions now scale, pog?)
-  Commodity Scaling (silly, experimental way of reducing the amount of commodities you can purchase in markets. stop engaging in arbitrage and go kill things)
-  No Free Storage (disables the free storage in the three abandoned stations in the Core Worlds. Ones outside the Core aren't affected, should they exist )
-  Secure Markets (that other feature that at least one person liked, more or less the same! markets have defenses and stations and in some cases, annoying patrols!)

if you give me cool, easily implemented ideas, they probably won't get added to the mod! (but i promise i'll think about it)

- **Everything is togglable and editable in LunaLib**, which is pog.
   - you can turn everything off and have a mod that does nothing!!
- **Should be safe to add and remove at any point**, which is very pog.
   - but i didn't mark it utility so don't blame me for anything ty
- **If you download this mod, I will like you at least a little bit more than if you didn't**, and really, what could be more pog than that?
   - *terms and conditions apply*

items.name: Take No Prisoners v0.16.1
items.summary:
Take enemy officers captive, learn their story and hire them!
` `
items.description:
Take enemy officers captive, learn their story and hire them!
` `
Take No Prisoners offers a narrative experience that most mods do not by allowing you to take enemy prisoners captive and actually have a one-on-one conversation with them rather than picking a dialog option that just gives you free money. Most vanilla factions have their own defined dialogues as part of this mod, so the prisoners you capture will be different across factions, and sometimes even within factions!

Phillip Andrada: Gas Station Manager has an extensive amount of content added if this mod is installed.

Changelog:
```
0.16.1 - update dialog methods to use dialog's interaction target's active person first if all of those exist
0.16 - updated for 0.96a, with new license
```

Download: https://github.com/scardwell15/takenoprisoners/releases/download/v0.16.1/TakeNoPrisoners-v0.16.1.zip

items.name: Thog's Domain - More Explorarium Drones
items.summary: A mod which adds a variety of "new" (poorly kitbashed) domain derelict drones in Explorarium livery, ranging from supplementary logistics craft to a variety of fighters, line ships and carriers, as well as two module-based ships - one gargantuan and haphazard in design, and one tiny and - arguably - much more practical, if unusual.
items.description:
A mod which adds a variety of "new" (poorly kitbashed) domain derelict drones in Explorarium livery, ranging from supplementary logistics craft to a variety of fighters, line ships and carriers, as well as two module-based ships - one gargantuan and haphazard in design, and one tiny and - arguably - much more practical, if unusual.

In the future, it will likely include some unqiue bounties - one of which will make the currently rarely-encountered Cryosleep guardian, the Leper, a unique one-time contract. But for now, the mod doesn't increase the likelihood of encounters with Derelicts in any way, and so I recommend the use of an additional mod to do so if desired.

You can find it here:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=27632.0

```v0.5 - Save Compatible with v0.4.7
    -Increased the damage of TTSC Medium Range Laser from 75 to 85 - With the same OP as the TTSC Tactical laser it needed more DPS to make sense
    -Lowered the tier of the TTSC Medium and Long range lasers from 2 to 1 - Should allow them to show more frequently in TTSC markets

items.name: UAF Skills
items.summary: *This mod is being shared with CY / Milkydromeda's permission.*
items.description:
*This mod is being shared with CY / Milkydromeda's permission.*

A mod that grants you access to the 3 unique UAF skills. The effects are mostly unchanged but some modifications were made to make them usable or more enjoyable. Check the Read Me for the full list of changes.

Also for those of you worried about potential issues: the skills you use as the player aren't the actual UAF skills but rather identical copies so no risk for conflicts.

Requires the United Aurora Federation

https://drive.google.com/file/d/14psEyn0ig66H9lpWneDnb-p2-L-fr6j2/view?usp=drive_link

Safe to add and to update. Probably not safe to remove.

All credit for the art (with the exception of the elite outlines which I made myself),
the original code and the ideas featured in this mod go to the UAF dev team.

Forum post coming soon.

items.name: Unofficial Rule Book v1.2.0
items.summary: Ever growing collection of various rules and challenges for Unofficial New Game Plus by Originem.
items.description:
Ever growing collection of various rules and challenges for Unofficial New Game Plus by Originem.

Adds 13 negative, 5 positive, 1 golden negative, 1 golden positive, 5 milestones and 1 golden milestone rules.

If anyone finds a bug or a crash, or just has any feedback, feel free to ping me (actually I oblige you to).

GitHub: https://github.com/DemonX3/URB
Direct download: https://github.com/DemonX3/URB/releases/download/Release/URB_v1.2.0.zip
`Requires UNGP and MagicLib`

```
v1.2.0 as of 07.10.2023
Content:
- Added 1 golden positive, 1 golden negative, 5 negative and 2 milestone rules.

Changes:
- Updated to Starsector 0.96a-RC10.
- 'The Unyielding':
 - Changes to how rule handles transfer countdown.
 - Removed jitter.
 - Added simple effects and sounds for activation and deactivation. Everything is temporary and will be worked on over the course of time. Maybe.
- 'Dazing Pilotage' duration decreased from 3/5/7/12 to 2/3/5/6. This is to make this negative rule a saner choice. It's still annoying but shouldn't be as fatal as before.
- 'Deathless' now only replenishes half the values to capital-class ships.
- Added hullmod blacklist to 'Antagonism'. Added an entire one hullmod to it that doesn't even go nuts at certain conditions when applied to enemy ships by the rule. :crab: SAFETY OVERRIDES ARE GONE! :crab:
    I'll be filling it up over time if/when people or I myself encounter crashes or other major problems with various modded hullmods added through this rule.
    Modders can add to that blacklist on their own account I suppose. Unless hullmod does something mythical there shouldn't be a need for that.
    Worst case scenario I will reverse it to a whitelist and add a config to enable current behaviour in the future.

- And perhaps other things that I completely forgot to put here and no longer remember what that was. If I forgot, it wasn't that important, right?
```

items.name: Yunru Industries
items.summary:
Changelog:
> - Removed ability to upgrade Bazaar to Commerce for increased compatibility
items.description:
Changelog:
> - Removed ability to upgrade Bazaar to Commerce for increased compatibility
> - Removed requirement to build a Bazaar to make a Commerce
> - Removed Tech-Mining change and made it it's own mod once more

Contents:
> Bazaar: Adds an open market to the colony, and a black market if free port is enabled.
> Auxiliary Shipbays: Increases the size of fleets produced by the colony, so you can enjoy more defenses with less FPS loss.
> Secondary Drydocks: Lets you dedicate a second industry slot to your Heavy Industry. Can also act as a backup Heavy Industry in a pinch.
> Advent Outreach: Train your security forces to take advantage of native knowledge. Note that on worlds with less than 100% hazard this would cause your forces to become lax and less effective.
